frame.name: Estimated_value
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> has carried out an approximate calculation or considered some <fen>Evidence</fen> and produced an approximation of the <fen>Value</fen> of a feature of an <fen>Item</fen>. There are two alternative construals in which the relationship between the feature and the <fen>Value</fen> is conceived. Either a holistic <fen>Estimation</fen> by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is presented, or the <fen>Question</fen> that is addressed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s estimating is given.
<ex>You can list a <t><fex name="Value">ballpark figure</fex></t> <fex name="Item">for shipping and handling</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Moreover, <fex name="Cognizer">their</fex> <t><fex name="Value">estimate</fex></t> <fex name="est">of 0.27 Â°C mean surface warming per century due to land-use changes</fex> is at least twice as high as previous estimates based on urbanization alone.</ex>
<ex>Our decision to trust people depends on <fex name="Cognizer">our</fex> <t><fex name="Value">estimate</fex></t> <fex name="que">of how trustworthy they are</fex>.</ex>
<ex>To help you anticipate the cost of your move, movers will give you an <t><fex name="Value">estimate</fex></t> <fex name="que">of the price</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual who has considered evidence or performed calculations to produce the approximation.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Her</fex> <t>estimation</t> was that they had exported up to 180000 fish.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition:
<def-root>The position or area on the feature scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has concluded the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
<ex>Sotheby 's <t>estimate</t> of its value <m>was</m> <fex name="val">$10m-$14m</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that possesses a feature whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated.
<ex>He's an engineer and he is supposed to know the <t>estimate</t> <fex name="Item">of the house</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition:
<def-root>Some fact perceived by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which has contributed to their estimation of the <fen>Value</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Evidence">habitat area based</fex> <t>estimate</t> is probably the more reliable projection of the two.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> formed the estimate.
<ex>That is 30000 higher than <fex name="Time">last year's</fex> <t>estimate</t> of 2.65 million</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has formed their estimate. </def-root>

FE.name: Estimation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a feature's <fen>Value</fen>.
<ex>One <t>estimate</t> <m>was</m> <fex name="est">that eventually I had lost about 80% of my blood</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Question
FE.definition:
<def-root>An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
<ex>Galliard decided Rwanda was different, and he went public with his <t>estimate</t> <fex name="que">of how many people had been killed in a matter of two weeks</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: estimate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an approximate calculation or judgement.

lexUnit.name: estimation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: approximate calculation (of a feature's value)
